channel.title: Client help
channel.description:
i have my server done and everything. It is already added to codefasga but the only problem i have is my clients not working, i have windows 7 vista and when i open my client i can log in but once i move the client shuts down. I downloaded a thing that changes bat files called windows 7 converter, i use it on my client run.bat but when i click on it it says press any key to continue and it still doesnt work. Can anyone help me pleasee?? I want to get back to coding servers!
:EDIT: Yes i have a 64-bit and this is a 317 server

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @baseball4355 baseball4355
item.description:
@baseball4355 wrote:

kilop:

Really, I have no idea. Open that folder and tell me if there’s a bin folder in it.

for the jdk? yes and for the jre? yes. in the jre there is a client folder

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

Really, I have no idea. Open that folder and tell me if there’s a bin folder in it.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @baseball4355 baseball4355
item.description:
@baseball4355 wrote:

kilop:

That’s what you edited it to? It has to be “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java”

ok well that didnt work it said

Error: could not open `C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\lib\i386\jvm.cfg’
Press any key to continue . . .

but i looked in java files and in jre6 there is no jvm or even lib folder, but in my jdk1.6.0_20 there is that, so i changed it to this…

@echo off
title Run server
“C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.6.0_20/bin/java” -cp .;./classes; server
pause

so instead of jre6 it is jdk1.6.0_20 (my jdk) but when i run thattttt i get this error…

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248)
Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

what now

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

That’s what you edited it to? It has to be “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java”

Read full topic

i get this error on run.bat

Error: could not open `C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\lib\i386\jvm.cfg’
Press any key to continue . . .

same with the client, i get the same error

Read full topic

item.title: Client help

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

Both, put on the client one

@echo on "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java" -Xmx500m -cp . Class51 30 0 highmem members 32 pause

And for the source

@echo off title Run server "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/java" -cp .;./classes; server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @baseball4355 baseball4355
item.description:
@baseball4355 wrote:

kilop:

Okay right click your run.bat then click edit. Once you’re there, there should be a start javaw or start java if its start javaw put this code in “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/javaw” but keep quotes and delete the start javaw though and if it’s start java, do the same thing except instead of it saying bin/javaw put bin/java but make sure you keep the quotes or it won’t work.

wait edit which one. the client bat file or the source. this is what the client run.bat says… (im using drowning source)

@echo on
java -Xmx500m -cp . Class51 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

this is what the source run.bat says…

@echo off
title Run server
java -cp .;./classes; server
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

Okay right click your run.bat then click edit. Once you’re there, there should be a start javaw or start java if its start javaw put this code in “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/javaw” but keep quotes and delete the start javaw though and if it’s start java, do the same thing except instead of it saying bin/javaw put bin/java but make sure you keep the quotes or it won’t work.

Read full topic
